title: Descent 2 Playthrough -- Part 3
description: Wow this game got difficult in the last system. Overall I enjoyed this more than the first game, but the bosses were pretty fuckin dumb unfortunately. Great game though, loved most of it :D

Guess that's not an issue if you're getting a new card, though
I just bought cheap used 270 and it's kinda big upgrade from intel graphic
Kappa
How are y'all doing
I have 182 tests failing out of 12572. You?
Tests of what? And just relaxing after physical therapy
Do you have to take care of failed tests, or you just return it to dev team (or are you just developer yourself)?
Of our program running in the server
Roger
And I'm in fact the dev who is in charge of solving these issues, but they are mostly coming from a 3rd party library
So I'm mostly kicking those people's butt to make it work
OSsloth
oh , I always wondered if full blown testers do anything about failed tests or they just return stuff
this stream is making me feel comfy
FrankerZ
Now, for your kicks, do you use quick or fierce kick?
Kappa
b
Testers usually just generate reports and file bugs on bug trackers
I used to use quick, but now switched to fierce
Kappa
Fierce is always better anyway, makes people
stylesRage
sometimes
I love the fact that our slack chat with the customer's team has doomguy emotes
DOOMGuy
I can now react to new bugs appropriately
It's not like I just forget to wipe my ass and piss all over the bed
reep
SMSkull
Hey cubeface
Did I miss HL runs ?
HF then
hiya
oh man, on the last world now?
yeah, the new enemies they add for the last world are really brutal
all the levels in the last world are pretty small comparatively speaking
I believe Smart Missile plasma accelerates when it's locked onto a target
not sure about that but it sure feels like it
How many maps is there?
30 in total, 6 of them are secret maps
You seem like play without end to this
so he's on 22/24
Yeah, Homing Missiles can only turn so quickly, and also can only maintain a lock as long as their target is in front of them
so rushing at them is a good way to make the missiles miss
one of the reasons we use a source port is homing missiles' tracking is CPU dependent in the original engine
which means that with modern systems, they're almost undodgeable in a lot of situations
source port restricts that behavior to what would have been the expected behavior given system capabilities at the time
they REALLY want to make sure you can handle dodging homers in this level
Well...
I think there's 10~15 Lou Guards throughout the level
Does this game has a tas?
not that I know of
would probably be hell to optimize
this reactor room has a speedstrat that is so hard to pull off
you have pretty much exactly enough time to go in, kill the reactor, and exit again before the door locks
it's really really tight
I don't know if I've ever gotten it in a run
Omega's really good if you're bad at aiming
it's short range and auto-locks into anything in front of you
but it has a separate energy bank and needs time to recharge
yeah, kinda like chain lightning without the chain
Omega becomes more valuable in higher difficulties. Those Hornets get a lot faster and harder to hit, and Omega makes it a lot easier to deal with them.
Smart Missiles really smart
those people need to git gud
You mean Stalker?
In last of us they move really slow.. those games are basically made that even if they want to flank you, only one enemy actually does that
So they go to their deaths
Instead of like flushing you out of cover
So that others will be ready to shoot you
But it also has zombie AI that can hear almost everything and upgraded zombies that insta kill you
If you don't have an upgrade or something
yeah
the missile does some damage in itself too
but it's every plasma bit hitting you instantaneously that really murders you
heh, that's the gimmick of this level
it's really short and condensed, but there's no source of energy in the entire level
you've been right to stick with gauss for the entire time
giving that Lou Guard a bit of a chest bump there
remember that weird reactor room from the first game with all the locked doors? Similar deal here.
gotta head out. Good luck with the final boss!
